data.title: Beyoncé's albums in order and full track lists
data.meta_description: A full breakdown of every single Beyonce album in order and the full track lists: from Renaissance all the way back to Dangerously In Love
data.text:
Oh, Beyoncé. We haven't been able to get enough of her since her days in Destiny's Child and we are even more obsessed now she is performing all over the globe for her Renaissance world tour. From 'Crazy in Love' to 'Break My Soul', Beyoncé has sung some of the most iconic songs ever and whether you feel in love, heartbroken or Sasha Fierce, she has an album for it.

Given just how big Beyoncé's discography is, it can be hard to keep track of how many records she has released. But, look no further, as we've listed all of Beyonce's albums in order and listed the full track list for each one. Anything for you, Bey-hive!

How many albums does Beyonce have?

So, bare with us here. Officially, Beyoncé has nine studio albums as a solo artist after confirming her newest album Renaissance Act II will be dropping on 29th March 2024.

She also has deluxe versions of her albums Lion King: The Gift, I Am... Sasha Fierce and B'Day, plus three live albums include Homecoming, so if you include these, the grand total is up to 15. That's enough Beyoncé to last you a lifetime!

Now, on to those nine albums and their full track lists...

All of Beyonce's albums in order

Dangerously in Love (2003)

Beyoncé's first studio album after her days in Destiny's Child was Dangerously in Love, released on 24th June, 2003. Her debut record set her up as the iconic, award-winning musician she is today and earned her her first number one single with 'Crazy in Love'. The original version features 15 songs and runs for a total of one hour and 52 seconds.

Here's the full track list: 'Crazy in Love' featuring Jay-Z, 'Naughty Girl', 'Baby Boy' featuring Sean Paul, 'Hip Hop Star' featuring Big Boi and Sleepy Brown, 'Be With You', 'Me, Myself & I', 'Yes', 'Signs' featuring Missy Elliot, 'Speechless', 'That's How You Like It' featuring Jay-Z, 'The Closer I Get To You' featuring Luther Vandross, 'Dangerously in Love', 'Beyoncé Interlude', 'Gift From Virgo', 'Work It Out' and 'Daddy'.

Deluxe tracks: '03 Bonnie and Clyde' featuring Jay-Z, 'I Can't Take No More' and 'What's It Gonna Be'.

B'Day (2006)

Beyoncé's sophomore album came three years later, and was released on her 25th birthday on 4th September, 2006. This is definitely one to dance to when you're home alone and feeling your best self, plus there's a few empowering breakup songs among its 11 tracks like 'Irreplaceable'. This one runs for a total of 38 minutes and two seconds.

Here's the full track list: 'Deja Vu' featuring Jay-Z, 'Get Me Bodied', 'Suga Mama', 'Upgrade U' featuring Jay-Z, 'Ring the Alarm', 'Kitty Kat', 'Freakum Dress', 'Green Light', 'Irreplaceable', 'Resentment' and 'Check On It' featuring Bun B and Slim Thug.

Deluxe tracks: 'Encore for the Fans', 'Listen' (from Dreamgirls), 'Beautiful Liar' featuring Shakira, 'Welcome to Hollywood' featuring Jay-Z, 'Flaws and All', 'Worldwide Woman', 'If' and 'Amor Gitano'.

'I am... Sasha Fierce' (2008)

Here, we meet Beyoncé's alter ego, Sasha Fierce. "Sasha Fierce is the fun, more sensual, more aggressive, more outspoken side and more glamorous side that comes out when I'm working and when I'm on the stage," Beyoncé said at the time. Released on 12th November, 2008 and at one hour and one minute long with eight songs, this album is such a vibe.

Here's the full track list: 'If I Were A Boy', 'Halo', 'Disappear', 'Broken-Hearted Girl', 'Ave Maria', 'Smash Into You', 'Satellites', 'That's Why You're Beautiful', 'Single Ladies', 'Radio', 'Diva', 'Sweet Dreams', 'Video Phone', 'Hello, 'Ego' and 'Scared Of Lonely'.

Deluxe tracks: 'Ego' featuring Kanye West, 'Why Don't You Love Me', 'Honesty', 'Save The Hero', 'Disappear' and 'Ave Maria'.

'4' (2011)

Following a short career hiatus after having her first child, Blue Ivy, Beyoncé returned on 24th June, 2011 with her fourth album, '4'. At 46 minutes and 28 seconds, this track is full of much-loved belters that are perfect for your next karaoke night.

Here's the full track list: 'Love On Top', 'Party' featuring Andre 3000, 'Schoolin' Life', 'Countdown', 'I Miss You', 'Dance For You', 'I Care', 'Rather Die Young', '1+1', 'End Of Time', 'Run The World (Girls)', 'Best Thing I Never Had', 'Start Over' and 'I Was Here'.

Deluxe tracks: 'Dreaming'.

Beyoncé (2014)

This is one of Bey's most-loved albums by her fans, with themes of feminism, sex and beauty standards explored in its 14 tracks, running at 66 minutes and 35 seconds. We still can't get enough of this era and can't stop ourselves from dancing along to 'Partition' every time it comes on.

Here's the full track list: 'Pretty Hurts', 'Haunted', 'Drunk in Love' featuring Jay-Z, 'Blow', 'No Angel', 'Partition', 'Jealous', 'Rocket', 'Mine' featuring Drake, 'XO', 'Flawless', 'Superpower', 'Heaven' and 'Blue' featuring Blue Ivy.

Deluxe tracks: 'Flawless' featuring Nicki Minaj, 'Ring Off', 'Blow' featuring Pharrell, 'Standing On The Sun' featuring Mr. Vegas.

Lemonade (2016)

Now, this album had everyone talking. Released on 23rd April, Lemonade is allegedly inspired by being cheated on by Jay-Z (remember Becky with the good hair?) and is an empowering track of 12 iconic songs. The album is also accompanied by stunning short films for each song featuring the likes of Zendaya, Halle and Chloe Bailey, Amandla Stenberg, Serena Williams and more.

Here's the full track list: 'Pray You Catch Me', 'Hold Up, 'Don't Hurt Yourself' featuring Jack White, 'Sorry', '6 Inch' featuring The Weeknd, 'Daddy Lessons', 'Love Drought', 'Sandcastles', 'Forward' featuring James Blake, 'Freedom' featuring Kendrick Lamar, 'All Night', 'Formation' and 'Sorry'.

The Lion King: The Gift (2019)

Beyoncé stared as Nala in the 2019 remake of beloved Disney classic, The Lion King. For the movie, she created the soundtrack album which was released on 19th July, 2019 and features a whopping 27 tracks running for 54 minutes long. We know you only care about the songs Beyoncé sings, so we've listed her tracks below.

Here's the track list: 'Bigger', 'Find Your Way Back (Circle Of Life), 'The Nile' featuring Kendrick Lamar, 'Mood 4 Eva' featuring Jay-Z and Childish Gambino , 'Water' featuring Salatiel and Pharrell, 'Come Home', 'Brown Skin Girl' featuring St. Jhn, Wizkid and Blue Ivy, 'Otherside', 'Already' featuring Shatta Wale, 'My Power' featuring Tierra Whack Busiswa, Yemi Alade and Moonchild Sanelly and 'Spirit'.

Deluxe tracks: 'Black Parade'.

Renaissance (2022)

Up until recently Beyoncé's most recent album was Renaissance. Released on 29th July, 2022, the dance track was the soundtrack of the summer and amongst its 16 songs, features much-loved tracks like 'Break My Soul' and 'Alien Superstar'.

Here's the track list: 'I’m That Girl', 'Cozy, 'Alien Superstar', 'Cuff It', 'Energy' featuring Beam, 'Break My Soul', 'Church Girl', 'Plastic Off The Sofa', 'Virgo’s Groove', 'Move' featuring Grace Jones and Tems, 'Heated', 'Thique', 'All Up in Your Mind', 'America Has A Problem', 'Pure/Honey' and 'Summer Renaissance'.

Renaissance Act II (2024)

It's the news we've been waiting for! Queen Bey officially announced her next album Renaissance Act II will be dropping on 29 March 2024, during the Super Bowl on 11 February. As part of the announcement she has also shared the names of two new singles that will feature on the album 'Texas Hold Em'' and '16 Carriages'. And 'Texas Hold Em'' is already available to stream on Spotify now.

If the names of these two songs are anything to go by, it's likely her next album is going to have a country feel to it.

Right now we don't know what other tracks are on the album but we'll be sure to update you on them all when we know more!

You're welcome, Bey-hive!
